column4: When I try to download files in Links (textmode) I get permission denied. Can anyone help me with it?
what dir did you start links in?
/home/dator/files
ok...maybe check who owns ~/files. in a terminal do ls -l /home/dator/
actually do ls -l /home/dator | grep files and then see who owns it
The files is owned by me and not root.
ok, how about this. do you know the full address of the file you're trying to download, and do you have wget or curl installed?
I need to download the file in Links.
may i ask why?
It's complicated. I prefer not to explain. I tried to run Links with sudo, but that didn't work either. It's still "Permission denied".
ok...is that the full error, and are you stuck in CLI?
CLI is?
no graphiks
(no X)
Yes. It's no X-server and I don't want a X-server. :-)
sweet. errr, are you aware of GNU screen (best option) and of pressing alt+Fsomenumber to switch TTYs?
I use that. It's great.
totally :-). i just ask because it has copy/paste ability, and i figured another program could help. but i guess not. sorry
But that doesn't help the fact that permission is denied. The folder is owned by me (by dator) and it should work.
good point. what about the permissions? do ls -l again, and see if it has write permission (that'll be in the mess at the front)
It has permission, that's why it's so strange.
